SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.LoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class contains a series of methods used to set and to modify the primary scenes of the main gui. and to verify the user data when the different Players decide to log into the lobby.

  • Method Details

    • controlNickname

      public void controlNickname(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, NotBoundException
      Verifies if the username has been entered correctly. In case no username is entered, calls an exception.

      If an attempt is made to lookup or unbind in the registry a username that has no associated binding, calls an exception.

      If every control is passed successfully, passes the username

      to the GUI.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - is the event linked to username entering.
      Throws:
      IOException - is the exception called if the wrong username has been passed as input.
      NotBoundException - is the exception called when lookup or unbind in the registry for username that has no associated binding is attempted.

    • numberOfPlayer

      public void numberOfPlayer(boolean askNumberOfPlayer)
      This method sets the number of players for the current Game in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      askNumberOfPlayer - is the boolean representing if the number of players has been entered as consequence of an entering request displayed by the GUI.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initialize the url and resource bundle used for the setting of GUI scenes linked to the Players login.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - is the resources url.
      resourceBundle - is the bundle of the resources utilized in the scenes development.
      See Also:
      • Player

    • changeScene

      public void changeScene()
      this method is used to change the current scene with that displaying the request for entering the number of Players for the current Game.
      See Also:

    • ControlNumberOfPlayer

      public void ControlNumberOfPlayer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is used to manage the wait on joining players during the lobby creation, once the number of players for the current Game has been set.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the join event

      Parameters:
